newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore rubber ends flat in lifeless trading.
newsitem.headline: Singapore rubber ends flat in lifeless trading.

text.p: Rubber futures closed almost flat on Monday in thin, aimless trading with the thin volume in Japan weighing on the local market, dealers said.
The absence of fresh buying from major consumers and flat offtake in a local exchange looking for fresh factors conspired to depress the market, the traders said.

"It's quiet and boring. Nothing substantial has been done. It's a sleepy market looking for news to give it some life," a local rubber trader said. Traders said the market will drift through most of the week and see if the spot expiry in Japan on Friday will trigger any movement in the market.
"Even Japan is dead ahead of the expiry. Volume was so poor today," another rubber dealer said.
At around 0945 GMT, December RSS3 was seen at 124.50-125.50 U.S. cents a kg from 125.25 cents.
December RSS1 was seen at 177.00-178.00 Singapore cents (US$1.25-$1.26) a kg from the previous 178.00 cents.
December TSR20 was seen at 172.00-173.00 Singapore cents (US$1.22-$1.23) a kg against the previous 173.25 cents.
